title: Freakonomics
description: A rogue economist explores the hidden side of everything, challenging conventional wisdom.

title: The Wealth of Nations
description: The fundamental work on classical economics by Adam Smith, defining the free market.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
description: Daniel Kahneman explains the two systems that drive the way we think and make economic choices.

title: Capital in the 21st Century
description: An analysis of wealth inequality in Europe and the United States since the 18th century.

title: The Intelligent Investor
description: The definitive book on value investing. A book of practical counsel for investors.

title: The Joy of x
description: A guided tour of mathematics, from one to infinity, making complex concepts accessible to everyone.

title: Humble Pi
description: A comedy of errors in mathematics, showing what happens when math goes wrong in the real world.

title: Infinite Powers
description: How Calculus reveals the secrets of the universe, told through its fascinating history.

title: Zero: The Biography
description: The story of a dangerous idea. How the number zero changed mathematics and the world.

title: Prime Obsession
description: Bernhard Riemann and the greatest unsolved problem in mathematics.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History
description: Explores the history of humankind from the Stone Age to the Silicon Age.

title: The Tipping Point
description: How little things can make a big difference and how social epidemics start.

title: Quiet
description: The power of introverts in a world that can't stop talking.

title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
description: A trans-disciplinary non-fiction book about the fates of human societies.

title: Outliers
description: The story of success. Why do some people succeed while others fail?

title: Clean Code
description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship. Essential reading for any professional developer.

title: Life 3.0
description: Being human in the age of Artificial Intelligence. How AI will affect crime, war, justice, and jobs.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
description: Your journey to mastery. One of the most significant books on software development.

title: Steve Jobs
description: The exclusive biography of the creative genius who revolutionized technology.

title: Designing Data-Intensive Apps
description: The big ideas behind reliable, scalable, and maintainable systems.
